description: Erection of a temporary structure on site for use as a Marketing suite (sui generis).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This permission is for a limited period of 3 years and the building hereby permitted must be removed (and the land restored to its former condition) by or before 03/10/2021 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: The building is of a temporary nature and is unsuitable for retention on a permanent basis, to comply with Section 72 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed (0003-01 Rev B, 0003-02 Rev B, 0003-05 Rev D, 0003-06 Rev E, 0003-07 Rev E, 003-08 Rev D, and 0003-09 Rev F). 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - The roof area of the development hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area and, furthermore, no balustrades, railings or other means of enclosure or means of permanent access shall be erected on this area.
Reason: To control overlooking, and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
Condition : 4 - The cycle parking currently associated with the temporary marketing suite (as approved ander application reference 2015/7239) shall be retained for cycle parking purposes for the duration of the permission, and for the users of the development only and for no other purpose.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for cycle parking in accordance with Council policy DMT2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2018 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
